metadata.synopsis: Dribbles the clown (actually a doppelganger who stole the identity of the famous clown) is on a stage with Buddy the dog beside him. A large crowd looks on. In this scene, Dribbles invites the player on the stage. Player can 1) approach the stage 2) tell a companion to get up on stage or 3) refuse - in which case a fan will volunteer. At the end of the scene, Buddy the dog attempts to sneak up on whoever is on stage and attacks.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load act 3, BGO_Main_A, Circus of the last days. Walk through the checkpoint, and circle around the back of the circus. There will be a large crowd in front of a stage. Approach and the scene will trigger automatically.

163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dribbles stands atop the stage, a big smile on his face. Group of children crowded at the front.

113.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
113.text: Buddy the dog is my very best friend. Do you know why?
113.context: NodeContext: Over the top, pantomine acting - excited and joyful

182.speaker: Quinton
182.context: NodeContext: Calls out from the crowd, excited - knows this is part of the show.

140.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
140.text: Because with him, anything is paw-sible. Wa-hey!
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Buddy the dog is wearing a party hat. He growls - looking murderous. Crowd laughs.NodeContext: Big gestures at the 'wa-hey' (it's his 'signature' sound). Maybe jazz hands or a little dance?

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: Can we not find a more pleasant amusement? Gouging out our own eyeballs, perhaps?

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: Gods, I hate clowns. I'm not even sure clowns like clowns.

189.speaker: Astarion
189.text: Oh good, puns. Because clowns aren't enough of a horror already.
189.context: NodeContext: Not impressed at the clown's jokes

117.speaker: Wyll
117.text: Between you and me, I love a good clown - and Dribbles is the best.

186.speaker: Gale
186.text: Hmm. Not to my taste, but I'll take a clown over some hack magician pulling peonies from his breeches.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.context: NodeContext: She's been having fun so far but she doesn't like this clown.

208.speaker: Halsin
208.text: Why is that daubed fellow being forced before a crowd like so? Is he being punished? Ritualised humiliation?
208.context: NodeContext: Bemused (unfamiliar with the concept of clowns)

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.context: NodeContext: Little involuntary grunt of a laugh at a terrible joke, then immediate defensiveness as if player is looking at her. Mumbled, attention returned to stage.

201.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
201.text: Did you hear about the scarecrow who lost a fight?
201.context: NodeContext: Exaggerated, eager, looking around the crowd

2.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
2.text: He got the stuffing kicked out of him. Wa-hey!
2.context: NodeContext: Big gestures at the 'wa-hey' (it's his 'signature' sound). Maybe jazz hands or a little dance?

54.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
54.text: Oh, oh, you're all such good friends! I've had a wonderful time, but I have to go...
54.context: NodeContext: Turns to walk away while expectantly looking over his shoulder at crowd - waiting for them to call him back

94.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
94.text: Oh, well, if you INSIST. How about a magic trick? But first - I need a volunteer with nerves of steel and the heart of a lion!
94.context: NodeContext: Very dramatic - excited. He loves this trick.

148.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Locks eyes with the player.NodeContext: Puts his hands to his eyes and dramatically scans the crowd - suddenly locks eyes with the player.

50.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crowd laughs (making note for SFX)NodeContext: Big gestures at the 'wa-hey' (it's his 'signature' sound). Maybe jazz hands or a little dance?

10.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
10.text: Thank you to the loudmouth for volunteering for my next trick! Now, where, oh, where are you...?
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: leaning forward on last line, hands to eyes, to get a better look at player0NodeContext: Puts his hands to his eyes and dramatically scans the crowd - suddenly locks eyes with the player.

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *A prickling hum runs through your very being - your patron does not trust this clown. Not one bit.*

203.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
203.text: You - my special assistant. Come on up.
203.context: NodeContext: Serious and with a big smile. Crooks finger to approach. (the 'mask' hasn't dropped yet here, but the player should be a little 'wtf' at this moment)

150.speaker: Player
150.text: What are you going to do?

174.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
174.text: Buddy's been practising day and night for this next trick! What kind of friend would I be if I spoiled his grand finale?
174.context: NodeContext: dramatic gasp at the beginning of the sentence. Over the top, exaggerated and horrified.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I think my friend Shadowheart will make a far better assistant.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: Are you quite sure you have a friend called Shadowheart? Not an enemy?

171.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
171.text: Ooof - my heart! The enthusiasm is... too much! Now, up, up - double sharp! Or poor Buddy will think you don't like him.
171.context: CinematicNodeContext: clutching his heart, pretending to collapse on stage before springing upNodeContext: clutching his heart - as if about to collapse. Then straightens up - calling the companion up - the companion walks up onto the stage

5.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
5.context: NodeContext: gestures to companion, delighted - clearly excited for the trick

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: I'd advise you find someone to taste your food from now on.

69.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
69.text: Patience, patience! You'll get your time to shine - I promise.
69.context: NodeContext: reassuring the player, big smile. Clearly very excited.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: This is your time to shine, Lae'zel - up you go.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.context: NodeContext: Player asked Lae'zel to go on stage for a circus act

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: Chk. And here I thought ceremorphosis was the ultimate torment.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Go on, Karlach, up you go.

176.speaker: Karlach
176.text: Hang on now, soldier, I'm not paying for your sins.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: This had better be violent, sexy, or both.
0.context: NodeContext: up on a stage with a clown, very sceptical

52.speaker: Minsc
52.text: Honoured is Minsc! But be warned, jester - none may juggle my hamster but me.
52.context: NodeContext: Player has volunteered Minsc to go on stage with the clown. He's enthusiastic - but ends on a hint of friendly threat. Carries volumes of the last poor performer who may have tried to include Boo in the trick.

188.speaker: Minsc
188.text: On closer inspection, Boo, this clown does not much look like the jolly sort...
188.context: NodeContext: Growing trepidation - the clown is pretty creepy close up, and Minsc's mirth is fading fast

93.speaker: Player
93.text: You love the spotlight, don't you, Astarion? Here's your big chance.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: What? No. Don't you dare. This isn't funny.
33.context: NodeContext: Astarion is shocked that the player's volunteering him - he's genuinely a little spooked by the clown. Last line is stressed, almost hissing

134.speaker: Astarion
134.text: Of course, what fun! I'm going to fucking kill you.
134.context: NodeContext: he's just been pulled up on stage by a clown and is DEEPLY uncomfortable. Tries to loudly play along with a friendly wave in the first line, then hisses the second to the player under his breath. Still smiling, of course (He moves to the stage in a seperate cinematic node. No need to mocap that here.)

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I think this is a job for the Blade of Frontiers, don't you, Wyll?

200.speaker: Wyll
200.context: NodeContext: charming smile, talking to the crowd

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Gale, you're good at tricks, right? Up you go.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Truly? I might as well go mount the gallows.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: You truly are testing the patience of a man who could level a city if he wished, you know.

66.speaker: Halsin
66.text: The local customs are... veiled to me. Are you sure this is wise?
66.context: NodeContext: Unsure. (he's participating in a stage trick at a circus but doesn't understand the concept at all)

76.speaker: Halsin
76.text: Very well... Oak Father, shield me in the trials to come.
76.context: NodeContext: Mustering bravery (he's participating in a stage trick at a circus but doesn't understand the concept at all)

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Well, Jaheira? Care to make your debut?

152.speaker: Jaheira
152.text: You think I haven't mounted a stage before? Though be warned, clown - if you mean to throw knives, I will throw them back.
152.context: NodeContext: Player has just urged her on up on stage with a clown looking for volunteers. Surprisingly, she doesn't get grumpy - but second line is a sharp warning to performer

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: You understand the nature of a secret organisation, yes?
17.context: NodeContext: Player has just cheered her on as the High Harper on stage in front of a crowd. Deadpan - 'are you actually that dumb?'

204.speaker: Player
204.text: My good friend Minthara is the funniest person I know.

168.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
168.text: Am I indeed? Perhaps I will tell my favourite joke. It is about you, bleeding to death.
168.context: NodeContext: responding to being sent onto a stage to perform in a circus show with a clown. She's irritated and half-sincere about enjoying the player bleeding ot death.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Go, Minthara! Tell the one about the man who married a drider!

39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
39.context: NodeContext: on a stage, performing for a crowd, and delivering a  punchline that she knows is terrible - delivered completely deadpan and with barely concealed anger

4.speaker: Player
4.text: This clown's looking at you funny. What's his deal?

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *You stare, but glean no ill-intent from the clown. Perhaps the makeup just threw you off.*

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *Your patron's truesight does not reveal any simple glamours or illusions at play.*

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *It does, however, pick up something else. The clown's eyes are brimming with evil intent.*

170.speaker: Narrator
170.text: *You've been here before, and you'll be here again. The clown is sizing you up, getting your measure.*

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *It's a trap - one that this clown is eager to spring.*

162.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
162.text: Come now, don't be a Cowardly Connie. Perhaps you need a little encouragement?
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: shot of one or two ppl clappingNodeContext: looks at crowd expectantly, raising his hands to 'give it up' for the player.

127.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
127.text: Now, up, up, double sharp! Or poor Buddy here might think you don't like him.
127.context: NodeContext: AGHAST at the thought of ANYONE not like buddy. Calling out to the player from the stage.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Approach the stage warily, keeping an eye out.

161.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
161.text: A round of applause for the stalwart heart!
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player climbs the stage.NodeContext: Claps - loudly pleased and encouraging.

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: Chk. I'll clap when it's over.

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: I'm glad you volunteered - I didn't want to have to shove you forward in my place.

193.speaker: Astarion
193.context: NodeContext: Absolutely no enthusiasm whatsoever. (He's watching the player climb on stage with a clown. Everyone else is cheering. Astarion is not a fan of clowns)

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: Go on, have your fun - you won't regret it!

73.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
73.text: Now, I always tell children that they're special. That each and every one of them is unique.
73.context: NodeContext: eager and earnest. Very much like he's talking to a child (he's not, he's talking to the player)

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *You notice the clown reaching for something behind his back.*
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dribbles reaches for something behind his back

196.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
196.text: Tell me - what makes you special?
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: leaning forward   - one hand behind his back (he doesn't actually have anything in his hand, but it LOOKS like he could be reach for a weapon).NodeContext: eager and earnest. Very much like he's talking to a child (he's not, he's talking to the player)

40.speaker: Player
40.text: My courage: I do something even if it scares me.

198.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
198.text: Boring, boring! Anyone can do that.
198.context: NodeContext: yelling and swatting the air almost at 'BORING'. Big booming voice - not impressed.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I treat everyone around me with kindness.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: My strength, of course. I won't let anything stand in my way.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: There's something unique about my... brain.

63.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
63.text: No, no - it's not that silly head of yours.

141.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
141.text: Oh my, soooo big and scary. You could give a kitty-cat a run for its money! But alas, that's not it.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I can magically transform into an animal at will.

70.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
70.text: Woooow, you hear that, folks? It can turn into a little rabbit, maybe a kitty-cat! No, that's not what makes you special.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I signed a contract with a fiend. Written in fire, forged in blood.

8.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
8.text: No no no! I don't care about your special friends, I'm talking about you.

71.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
71.text: You, my friend, are the most special person in the circus - in all of Baldur's Gate! Does anyone know why?
71.context: NodeContext: turning to the crowd, eager and exaggerated

72.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
72.text: You're special, my friend, because I have a message - just for you!
72.context: NodeContext: excited, like it's the biggest deal in the world

81.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leans towards player with a vicious smile - whispersNodeContext: this is the mic drop, the big hail hydra moment. Vicious smile, whispers. All of dribbles is gone - all that's left is a vicious cold murderer.

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *You sense something behind you - instinct takes over.*

62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player dodges out of the way as the dog leaps for the player. Combat starts.

157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dog lunges towards player. Player turns around - shocked. Cut to combat. Player starts the combat injured.

61.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
61.text: Hah! The Absolute finally sent me someone worthy. Praise her!

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Huzzah! Should this prove embarassing, just imagine the audience in the nude.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Ah come on, soldier, you've been through worse - nearly.

109.speaker: Halsin
109.text: Oak Father protect you, my friend! You shall weather this trial, I know it!
109.context: NodeContext: Calling out sincere encouragement (the player has been forced to participate in a clown's stage act. Halsin doesn't understand the concept)

126.speaker: Jaheira
126.text: Hmph. A proper circus would provide some fruit to throw.
126.context: NodeContext: Amused, watching the player get dragged up on stage by a clown while the crowd cheers on

146.speaker: Minsc
146.text: HAH, THAT IS OUR FRIEND! BOO WISHES TO SEE THE TRICK WITH THE KNIVES!
146.context: NodeContext: Appropriately Minsc volume - supporting the player as they go on stage with the clown. First line earnestly bragging to crowd, second line making a request

165.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
165.text: If all else fails, kill the clown. That is sure to amuse the crowd.
165.context: NodeContext: watching a friend take the stage at a circus, expecting them to be humiliated by a clown. she's only half-joking about the merits of killing the clown for laughs

144.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
144.text: Have I only mice in the audience, or does someone here know the meaning of courage?
144.context: NodeContext: dramatic, looking for rile the crowd up so someone will volunteer

64.speaker: Quinton
64.context: NodeContext: volunteers from the crowd - excited and delighted. He's always wanted to be in a dribbles show

89.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
89.text: Finally - someone with steel in their spine! Come on up!
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fan eagerly runs onto the stage - stop beside dribbles.

143.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
143.text: Before we begin, I owe you all a most humble apology. This wasn't how the show was supposed to go.
143.context: NodeContext: Looking to crowd - making an exaggerated sad face. Heartfelt and sincere.

11.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
11.text: I chose you - yet you refused me. So know that this...
11.context: NodeContext: speaking to player - gestures to confused fan. Sounds BIT more menacing, but the mask hasn't quite dropped yet. Still smiling and cheeful.

28.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
28.context: NodeContext: tone drops - the mask is gone. He sounds cruel and vicious. This is the big 'hail hydra' moment.

135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dog slashes the NPC's chest - they fall and die. Combat begins.

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *The hair on the back of your neck raises as a shiver passes through you.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *A bloodthirsty rush of fury engulfs you. You want to butcher the crowd, women and children alike, and soak in their innards. It is glorious.*

167.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
167.text: You hear that, Buddy? We've got ourselves a Debbie Downer!
167.context: NodeContext: AGHAST. Who would dare be a debbie downer????

151.speaker: Quinton
151.context: NodeContext: Big over the top BOO. Cupping hands to face, in crowd.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Relax and enjoy the show - it's been forever since you've seen Dribbles perform.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Sure did - his opponent was really clutching at straws!

36.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
36.text: Wa-hey! Looks like we've got a proper comedian in our midst!
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse Wahey anim for dribbles on this node

31.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
31.text: Good thing too, I'll need someone with your wits for my next trick. Now, where are you...?
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: leaning forward on last line, hands to eyes, to get a better look at player0NodeContext: Puts his hands to his eyes and dramatically scans the crowd - suddenly locks eyes with the player.

207.speaker: Minsc
207.context: NodeContext: Slow burn. Minsc is in the crowd as a clown makes a terrible joke. He gets it a second later then everyone else, but enjoys it ten times as much.

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: Just give the word, and I will kill the clown. We would be praised as heroes.
59.context: NodeContext: reaction to watching a clown deliver bad puns on a stage. She's not serious about being prasied as heroes, but she really would like to kill the clown, even though she knows it's inappropriate/illegal.
